etymology.description: 样 ‘pattern; style’ + 板 ‘board; plate’ = model/template used for copying or measurement
etymology.interpretation: Merges the idea of a ‘pattern’ with a ‘board/plate’ to denote a standard piece or exemplar to follow. Common in manufacturing, design, and computing for prototypes or code templates.
etymology.simplification: 樣 was simplified to 样 by replacing the complex right-side phonetic component with the simpler 羊 form while keeping the 木 radical; 板 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们先做一个样板，再批量生产(我們先做一個樣板，再批量生產)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen xiān zuò yí gè yàngbǎn, zài pīliàng shēngchǎn.
examples.english: We’ll make a sample first, then mass-produce.

examples.chinese: 这段代码可以当作样板，用来生成新项目(這段代碼可以當作樣板，用來生成新項目)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè duàn dàimǎ kěyǐ dāngzuò yàngbǎn, yòng lái shēngchéng xīn xiàngmù.
examples.english: This code can serve as a template to generate new projects.

examples.chinese: 设计师用样板校对尺寸(設計師用樣板校對尺寸)。
examples.english: The designer uses a template to check the dimensions.
